tweet: My god. A music teacher just called in to @CBCOntarioToday to report she's expected to work in 3 different schools with multiple classes in each. Did we learn nothing from the LTC fiasco in this province?! #UnsafeSeptember

A small fraction of deaths in long-term care facilities are staff members. Nonetheless, researchers estimate that, by year’s end, COVID-19 will make working in an LTC facility the most dangerous job in America in 2020.

Actually, @kerpen has been tracking this more extensively and for far longer. And while we're at it, over half the deaths in this country are from LTC facilities and we're still tip toeing around society with kids and young adults like it's Ebola. Maddening.

34,000 LTC deaths have occurred since June. Even after COVID-19’s risks were established, facilities struggled to obtain rapid testing and personal protective equipment. One health economist calls the federal government’s response a “dismal failure.”

In recent weeks, #Litecoin P2P trading volume surged by 350% in Latin America and 266% in Sub-Saharan Africa.  Until L2s become easy to use, high network fees on $ETH and $BTC are driving small peer-to-peer transactions to cheaper blockchains.
